RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 20, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since July 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lb s. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNCANNY took over approaching the half mile pole, rated the pace and won mostly of her own initiative. SWEETONTHEGENTS chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and dueled late for second. SALSA RITA chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn and finished well to take third late. SCARLET TANAGER engaged in close early chase, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MANHATTAN WEAVE took the lead two deep midway on the opening turn and rated the pace, was urged clear at the quarter pole then kept to steady urging in the lane. STRINGFELLA rated close inside, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced two deep while between horses on the far turn, then dueled through the stretch for second. EISELE rated close off the rail, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced three wide on the far turn then relented in the stretch duel for second. GARITOFF raced with the early pace inside then stalked toward the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths but dropped back at the quarter and flattened the final sixteenth. CHESAPEAKE CHARLIE rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little more. A FAREWELL YODEL dropped back and saved ground early, eased out leaving the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. DOMINANT FACTOR saved ground.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 36300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 20 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Cons idered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL MISSION rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert to widen. PENGUIN PARADE rounded the first turn in the three path, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and had to settle for second. STRONG LIL KOKORO settled off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and came along to take third the final strides. ONE NIGHT MIKE stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened in the lane. SPANGLISH saved ground on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, bid toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. CATFISH rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail far turn,kept alert to widen

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Lil Kokoro
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,along 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: One Night Mike
ENTRY.OWNER: Sterbenz Racing LLC and O'Sullivan Farms LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CEDAR'S WISH pressured the pace off the rail, took over two deep toward the top of the stretch and held on well under steady handling. DIXIE YODELER chased inside, raced close in the three path of the turn, dug in for second mid-stretch but ran out of ground. SHENANDOAH CAT set a pressured early pace inside, was met at the rail approaching the top of the lane but dropped back toward mid-stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. FIFTY GRAY SHADES chased the leaders from the inside, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. HANDSOME JOANIE chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. TINA'S SONG gave chase then faded near the rail on the turn. LADY SPARROW became quite fractious in the gate, steadied at the start and never factored.

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Timothy C. Grams & Judith A. Grams

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROUD UNION saved ground off the early pace, bid leaving the half mile pole and improved in the five path of the far turn, left the turn outside, dug in for the lead later yards and raced clear nearing the wire. MY MIRACLE MAN moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dug in leaving the turn, but was caught in later yards. PLAYBOY ROY rounded the first turn about the five path, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn then dueled through the stretch for third. BET ON BITZ stalked the earlier pace from the three path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path then outfinished in the stretch duel for third. RAYO NEGRO rated close off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at a slim disadvantage off the rail on the far turn, then flattened inside the eighth pole. BOOZYMILKSHAKEBAR rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole but faded into the far turn. NEW SOUTH loped along.

ENTRY.NAME: Rayo Negro
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 3/8,close off rail far turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: My Miracle Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,caught later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Proud Union
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 1/2,5p far turn,outside 1/8,up late,cleared

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 21800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).

CLAIM.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

RACE.FOOTNOTES: PEARLY GHOST stalked two deep on the first turn and took the lead into the backstretch, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert through the stretch. IHEARTRAINACOMN rated close inside on the first turn, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and settled for second best. PHILMARY CASTLE set the early pace inside, was met and gave chase into the backstretch, raced near the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. I SHALLBE RELEASED rounded the first turn in the four path, left the turn toward the outside and gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and passed some rivals. MY SISTER PAM settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. ALLI BOBBY rounded the opening turn in the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, but flattened at the rail on the far turn. MAY MAYS CASTLE rated close in the two and three paths the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Iheartrainacomn
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 3/8,3p far turn,settled 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 101. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 37700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES SINCE JULY 20 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Rac e At A Mile Or Over Since December 20 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since November 20 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OUTLIER rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, left the turn off the rail and dug in under right hand encouragement, came in on the runner-up in late yards and held on well. DIXIE DRAWL stalked off the rail, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, moved to the rail leaving the turn but had to steady off the inside flank of Outlier late yards and flattened stride. SOUND OFF saved ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, dug in down the lane and held on for third. MIDNIGHT ACT stalked the early pace from the three path, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. MAXIMUM IMPACT settled toward the inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn then flattened in the lane. HOBE SOUND settled in the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. RRACE DAY WARRIOR rated close inside for three eighths, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. The Stewards reviewed a claim of foul against the rider of Outlier for interference in late stretch, lodged by the rider of Dixie Drawl, and disqualified the former to second place for coming in on the latter. ONE MILE AND FINAL TIME CHANGED FOLLOWING REVIEW.

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Drawl
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,challenged 7/16,close turn,steadied rail late

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Outlier
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,rail turn,came in late,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Rrace Day Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside for 3/8,chased 7/16,weakened into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Hobe Sound
ENTRY.OWNER: Eastham Richard and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GORUN saved ground off the pace, bid leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn in the three path, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and inched clear in the final strides. DADDY Z stalked from the three path on the first turn, challenged and took the lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, drew clear toward the quarter, raced at the rail on the far turn, was met mid-stretch and grudgingly ceded the final sixteenth. STEADY EDDIE took a slim lead at the rail into the first turn, drew briefly clear past the seven sixteenths pole but was met approaching the five sixteenths, dropped back nearing the quarter, raced off the rail on the far turn and flattened later yards. DEVIL'S CANYON raced off the pace in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the turn about the four path and raced evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. SLOE GIN BIZ raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. BROTHER MERLE raced in the seven path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. VELOCITO was not a factor. BUCKS LODGE tapered in and raced with the early pace two deep, gave chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole but faded past the three eighths. DOMINANT DESTROYER rounded the opening turn in the six path and left the turn toward the outside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but faded in the five path of the far turn. PRINCE'S REWARD rounded the first turn in the six path, left the turn outside and gave chase, but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Gorun
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up 1/16,inched clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Steady Eddie
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,clear past 7/16,met near 5/16,flatten later yds

ENTRY.NAME: Sloe Gin Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail early,chased 3/8,rail far turn,evenly lane
